intro: Lagenophora pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are pinnately divided. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
